definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
Li Peng (1928-), leading PRC politician, prime minister 1987-1998, reportedly leader of the conservative faction advocating the June 1989 Tiananmen clampdown
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
kun 鯤|鲲[kun1] and peng 鵬|鹏[Peng2], mythological beasts/peng, a gigantic bird transformed from the kun
lit. the giant Peng bird spreads its wings and begins to fly/displaying awesome power and momentum at the outset/to have the world at one's feet
flight of the roc (used in names)/soaring flight

sentences.english: We stop at Pin Wu for lunch, but Sam and David never come down.
sentences.chinese: 中途，司机在平武停下车吃午饭，鹏和嫣没有下车。

sentences.english: "Peng" symbolizes the fly, for the future.
sentences.chinese: “鹏”象征着展翅高飞，前程似锦。

sentences.chinese: 最后，鹏虽废玉之武功，但已与青阴阳相隔。

sentences.english: Perennial China will start trading on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 鹏瑞利的股票将于本周四开始交易。

sentences.english: This fish could change itself into the enormous bird called Peng(Roc), measuring thousands of kilometers in length.
sentences.chinese: 这条鱼能够变成鹏，一种庞大的鸟，有几百万米长。

sentences.english: Gao also called on Minister of Education Wu Ching-ji to step in and deal with the issue.
sentences.chinese: 高志鹏也请求教育部长吴清基要插手处理这个议题。

sentences.english: Body likeness Peng, facing Anne is small seven rush toward to pass by.
sentences.chinese: 身形似鹏，向着安小七扑过去。

sentences.chinese: 鹏之背，不知其几千里也，怒而飞，其翼若垂天之云。
